page.title: 19SCHOOL EXCHANGE part 2
page.content: The town was a little smaller than Limavady though it was very clean and bright as the townpeople took great pride in their surroundings. The school was about the same size as St Mary's but only had about one third the pupils. The floors were carpeted and there were coffee machines in the corridor. Classes were small; only twenty on average. There was no vandalism in the school and the pupils were able to address the teachers by their first names. Children do sit exams but the teacher gives all a mark and no-one fails !
